This is definitely something. Just after watching first two episodes, I am already so hooked into it.
There’s a very long review coming………
About the STORY
Every element used in the story are no doubt made sophisticatedly which make the storylines so very interesting and so damn exciting. The plot is really something to look forward to and so every revelation is so anticipating. The drama is not overly done. And I believe it is very rare to see Shounen or action stories with a very well-made drama because most have very cliché dramatic moments or it is very tragic. I don’t think making the dramatic element overthe top is necessary just to make viewers cry over it. The humor is genuinely funny as well. Because the storylines are so interesting and exciting, there are absolutely no dull moments in the series. You won’t get bored in any second of it. And I also love series that tackles stories about who’s right or wrong, the good or bad. That kind of storyline is always interesting because it is not merely about who’s right or wrong but there’s always a twist in it. 


About the CHARACTERS

Characters that have dark or evil sides are always a sure hit because it is definitely interesting to see them fight that side of them. Even more interesting because they are playing the fine line of being good and evil, much like Naruto and Ichigo. But this is quite different because it is the opposite. The protagonist does not only have an evil side but he is a demon himself. This is no longer a fight of who you are but a fight of what you are since the beginning of your life and that is really interesting in so many ways. Some characters are really entertaining and some are very mysterious but definitely all of them are interesting in their own way. Most of the characters are really mysterious but I think Mephisto is the most mysterious of all, even more than Rin himself. I just love characters that give you a hard time understanding them or predicting what they are really up to. You just can’t be sure if they are an ally or an enemy. One of the things that I love about this series is that it is not only about the main characters. Every character has their story focused so it becomes more and more interesting and exciting.


About OKUMURA YUKIO

Of course let’s not forget to talk about the very gorgeous Yukio. He’s the responsible and mature one compared to his older brother. He looks so hot when he’s wearing his teacher’s uniform and even hotter when he’s fighting with his gun. The combination of glasses, coat, guns and some cold yet kind attitude are just making him even more irresistible. And the fact that he’s the one who takes care of his brother despite the fact that he’s the younger one, makes him so admirable. Plus, the voice of Jun Fukuyama, one of the most talented seiyu ever, is absolutely perfect for his character. Jun is so amazing when it comes to characters with authority roles and of course the smart ones as well. Yes, much like Lellouch.


About OKUMURA RIN

Rin’s character might be typical for a protagonist in a Shounen type of series but he’s definitely interesting in so many ways. And of course, the most interesting about him is the fact that he is the son of Satan. I also love his very hot-blooded yet still kind-hearted personality. He’s also very positive considering that almost everyone is afraid and even trying to kill him. Plus, he’s so cute with his demon characteristics like his fangs, ears, and tail. He’s definitely one of the cutest demons I’ve ever seen. And he can be so funny as well. Despite of what he is, Rin has a genuine kind heart. That would be because of how he was raised. This really shows that it is not about what you are but what you have become. As cliché as it may seem but it really doesn’t matter if ones true self keeps on crawling out because if one is raise with genuine love and warmth, he’ll be just fine. That’s the very reason why, even when Shiro Fujimoto is already gone he’s character is still very much significant to the growth of not only Rin but to all of those that loves him and carries his values.


About OKUMURA TWINS

Another thing that I love about this series is that it is also a story about brotherly bond and love which I really love particularly if it’s quite different from the typical ones. Both are very different and complement one another. The older brother is the hot-blooded, immature, nasty, and simple-minded one while the younger is the calm, mature, sophisticated, and smart one. They argue a lot but it only shows how much they really care for each other. But one thing for sure, both are extremely so cool when they are fighting. Imagine a combination of a swordsman and a gunman. What’s cooler than that? Their relationship is different yet so cute and admiring. And my goodness, these twins are the most gorgeous looking twins I’ve ever seen. I think the biggest difference between the two would be that though Yukio is the smart one, he’s judgment is easily clouded as so he’s easily manipulated compared to Rin who has a strong resolve that’s why he doesn’t let what others think of him affect him nor tell him what to do or to believe.


About the ANIMATION

I’ve been itching to say it so let me just first mention that the characters are one of the most gorgeous looking characters I’ve ever seen in my countless encounter with hundreds of different animes. And the most gorgeous, hottest, and coolest are the Okumura Twins. I can’t even tell who’s more gorgeous with the two because both equally have their own hotness into them. I am already snapping tons of pictures just after watching the first 5 episodes of it. The animation is just beyond amazing. This is one of the very few series that has a genuine elevated animation much like High School of the Dead. With its very amazing fight scenes, I even think that it will not only compete on par with some of the famous animes of today but can even win over them. This is the reason why I am so damn grateful to see these latest series. I am just so glad that I am living at an age when animations are these amazing. And to think it will only get better and better as the years go by. And let’s not forget the superb uniforms that give more coolness and gorgeousness to the characters. And as if that’s not enough, this series has a major gathering of the most talented seiyus of all time which is extremely rare. By the way, the idea of blue flames instead of red flames is so unique and makes the series a lot cooler.


I genuinely get it why this series is so damn famous. And I totally understand why everybody is saying the same thing; WHY THE HELL THERE’S ONLY 25 FREAKING EPISODES? I am having a hard time understanding why there are not so great animes that are still ongoing but amazing animes like this one ends so quickly. Come on! At least make it 50 or 100 episodes or better yet continue adapting it into animation until the end like those famous anime of today. It is so complete; heart-warming drama, a little bit of romance, comedy, nice dialogues, amazing storyline and plot, interesting and likeable characters, gorgeous-looking and fashionable characters, talented seiyus, great sounds, one of the best animation of today, and of course, tons of heart-pounding fight scenes and actions.

love this anime because it reminds me a lot of d-gray-man and full metal alchemist. I love anime's with good story,art,sound,character, and enjoyment. I'm looking forward to a continue of series of this anime.

So, at first, I want to mention that this is my first review, and that my English is quite average because I'm French... But I hope it will help some people who wants to know if this anime worth it or not. 
-Story : 8/10
The story is really, really basic at the beginning. At first, I really thought "Oh, shit, just an other typical shonen story...". I'll try to don't spoil a lot, but I have to talk about the story in this part, of course, that's quite rational I suppose. It is the story of Rin. Him and his brother are the son ofSatan. One day, the man who have adopt him is killed by Satan... So Rin make the choice to become an exorcist and to kill his father for his revanche.

Yeah, it's a really average story, so why did I put a 8 ? Because this is just the beginning. The most you watch the anime, the most the story become good, and a great plot against Rin and his brother is starting. So, even if at first you can think that the story is average, it become really good !


-Art : 8/10


The Art is really good in Ao no Exorcist. At first, the charadesign is really good : boys are bishies, shy girls are cute, badass girls are sexy... But I really want to talk about the Gehene door. Everytime you see it, you can see the beautiful 3D Art.

The color are good too : dark in the sad or important moment, but the characters have all bright color compared to the background.


-Sound : 10/10


If you're listening to an Ao no Exorcist OST, then you are listening the sound of true EPICNESS. The OST are just magical. Fight music are all really EPIC, and it really adapt you to the mood of the moment. My favorites are all the Symphonic Suite Devil Movement. If you haven't watch the anime, just listen to this, and then think that the anime is as EPIC as this fabulous OST and technically you'll really want to watch the anime after that. 

There are "basic" OST too and they really make you enter in the mood of the funny moment (yes because Ao no Exorcist is quite funny), so I think they're really good too, because the real goal of an OST is to adapt your mood to the moment and to make your feels stronger, right ?


-Character : 10/10


Here is the strong point of the anime : the character. Because you can have beautiful art and beautiful music, but if all the characters are boring, then the anime will be bad. 

But here, the characters are fantastic.

At first, there is Rin and his brother, Yukyo. These two are really great main characters. Rin can seem a little stupid at first, and he is a really a sort of clod, but in fact, he has a big heart, and he'll try to prove in all the anime that, even if he is the son of Satan, he just want to protect his friends. 

Yukyo is quite the intellectual. In fact, he is even a prodigy, he is the youngest exorcist, and has always train himself because he want to protect his brother.

The relationship between this two characters is really strange, with hate and love, even if we can't really talk about shonen-ai. 


And of course, there is the "basic" characters, like the boy who want his revenge because Satan killed all his familly, the really shy but cute girl, or the tsundere who doesn't know how to be nice with peoples.


But of course there are other really interesting characters, like Mephisto Pheles. With his gentleman-looking air and his little tricks, it's hard to say if he is a bad guy or a nice guy until the end of the story. 

There is Arthur too, who can seem to be a bad guy at first, but who's in fact only obeying to the orders...


So, if you want just one good reason to watch Ao no Exorcist, do it for all the fantastic characters !


Enjoyment : 9/10


I really enjoyed this anime. It makes you laugh and cry, and sometimes I even got shiver because of the epicness ! I enjoyed it from the beginning to the end :D


Overall : 9/10


I could put a 10, but I've watched better shonen that Ao no Exorcist...

But it really is a great anime, so if you were hesitating, you should watch it, because this anime is totally awesome and you won't regret it !

This is an anime I picked up on a whim, I'm glad that I kept my expectations low. Every aspect of this show is average, though that can be an understatement with regard to certain elements. Let me elaborate.
To begin with, Ao no Exorcist's story is nothing to write home about. As can be gleaned from the synopsis, it is your typical shounen with a reckless underage hero who is tasked with saving the world from (literally) all evil. Candidly speaking, the 'demon-who-is-oblivious-to-his-true-identity' archetype to which the protagonist belongs is overused. However, this is not to say that the story is 'bad'. It just endsup being a little too predictable and fails to create a lasting impression. 


The rest of the characters also fall into well defined archetypes. For example, there is Yukio, the nerdy younger brother of the protagonist, the wise father Fujimoto and the usual bunch of tsunderes, tough guys, weaklings and the like. The only character who stands a little above the rest is the buxom, Kirigakura (yes, she is used for fanservice). In some situations, she is the only voice of reason among the often over-emotional cast. But as is the case with most shounen anime, being audacious when there is no apparent need for the same is considered admirable. A trait which I find very irritating. Not helping matters is the fact that only the protagonist is developed during the course of the series. That too, in a very predictable manner. It is very clear from the beginning that Okimura Rin is the demonic savior of humanity All in all, this is an average cast with passable group dynamics.


As for the art and and animation...well, they are hit and miss at best. There are some slick action sequences which are animated with very good particle effects. Alongside these is some truly horrible CGI. For example, there is one scene near the end in which insect-like demons explode through an opening in the ground. The whole thing is done in CGI and you can actually see the difference in frame rate between the 3D and 2D portions. This renders the whole scene a broken feel. The character designs are more consistent and generally well done. The blue flames that surround demonic characters lend them an imposing presence. 


Aurally, Ao no Exorcist is pretty good. The Japanese voice cast does an an almost flawless job. My personal favorite is Rina Satou , as Kirigakura. The soundtrack is also good, although it isn't as emphasized as it should be in the series. I especially liked the second ending 'Wired Life' by Meisa Kuroki.


Ao no Exorcist is by no stretch of imagination what I would call a good anime. Sure, it has its moments, but they're too far apart and disjointed from each other to amount to anything. Add to this, the visual inconsistencies and the under-emphasized OST. One can deduce that it had a lot of potential. But in the end, no aspect of the anime creates enough of an impression to make it worth your while. Unless of course, you are a hardcore fan of of the shounen genre or are relatively new to the medium

I want to start this review by saying that I loved the first sixteen to twenty episodes of this show.  Now I will begin the break down of the show.
Story:
The story seems generic but don't let that fool you into believing this is a generic show.  The plot revolves around the son of satan and his desire to become an exorcist after the death of his step-father.  The first episode won me over as it had humor and drama in good combinations.  Over the course of the anime the humor gradually declined and in the last few episodes the humor wasat such a minimum there were times I thought I was watching a different show altogether.  If the show had remained consistently brilliant even to the end I would have given the score of 9.  The ending, however, was disappointing and felt rushed beyond measure so I give the overall story a 7.  


Art:

I loved the art style of this show.  The highlight of this style is revealed when people on the show undergo demonic possession.


Sound:

The music for the show was forgettable, the sound effects in general were well placed.  Nothing major to say there.  The voice actors that stood out were Hiroshi Kamiya as Mephisto Pheles/Johann Faust and   

Nobuhiko Okamoto as the lead character Rin Okumura.  


Character:

This is the true driving force behind why I loved this show.  All the characters are fleshed out to make them unique.  My favorite character on the show is the supporting character Mephisto Pheles due to his ambiguous attitude and overall charisma.  As the series progresses you get a look deeper into some character back stories and most of these are well done.  The bad characters are interesting too for the most part especially Amaimon and Satan himself.   


Enjoyment:

I enjoyed watching the show until the last few episodes; the mood changed far too much by this point in my view.  If the show wasn't rushed to an ending the enjoyment would have been far greater.
